Fields.DialogueText: You're becoming quite ruthless in battle, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: What makes you say that?
Thanks. I think.
I learned from the best.

Fields.DialogueText: Take it as a compliment, Captain.
Pozhaluysta.
Ruthless... and flattering.
If only you were just as strong outside of battle.

Fields.MenuText: I take it the implication is that I should be more like you?
Who thinks I'm not strong?
And what exactly do you mean by that?

Fields.DialogueText: Not like me. Just a stronger version of yourself.
No one, but people will talk.
You must be careful with your feelings.
You're much too open with your feelings, Captain. It makes you...
A delight to be around?
Vulnerable.
*ALARM*
But there are always chances to prove otherwise.
@BATTLE
It seems Command has issued us a new mission.
More search and destroy? Boring.
Since when do you find battle boring?
Since it became maintenance work. Where are the real threats?
I'm sure the Morganas would be happy to accommodate you.
Good! Let them! Life should be about finding the hardest struggle.
Because struggle leads to peace?
No. Struggle leads to growth.
So we can't get better without struggle?
Precisely. The more uncomfortable you are, the more you stand to gain.

Fields.MenuText: I should ask for a more challenging mission, then.
We must settle for what we have.
Spoken like someone who's never had food poisoning.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes!
Settle? Only the dead settle. The rest of us must strive!
Don't be glib.
What will it be, Captain? Growth or death? Challenge... or weakness?
@BATTLE
I've been thinking about what you said.
And?
I've asked Command for a more... proactive mission. Which, yes, will mean more risk.
Excellent! You'll see, Captain. We'll all grow stronger because of it.

Fields.MenuText: And hopefully it'll make a bigger difference in the war as well.
It will do everyone on this ship some good.
We can brag about it *after* we get it done.

Fields.DialogueText: You'll look back on this and thank me someday.
More than good. It will harden their resolve, like iron.
Ha! Well said!
What is our mission?
You'll get the full briefing in a bit, but - the Morganas have been collecting damaged cargo ships, and we believe they've created a kind of dummy convoy.
A hidden enemy. I'm intrigued.
I thought you might be.
Then let the hunt begin!
@BATTLE
They leave these things drifting in the Atlantic, fake distress signals to lure in unsuspecting rescuers, and then feast. It's not subtle, but it's new, and it's been working for them.
We suspect they've got at least one aircraft carrier involved, and battleship support as well. It's our job to convince them that this is a strategy with no future.
Cossack, I have a question for you.
A question?
Do you... have any friends?
I have many comrades in battle.
Not in battle. I mean in normal life.
I do not understand.
Friends. Ones you spend time with, just having fun.
I... hm. I'm honestly not sure how to answer that.
You talk with other Belles. Are any of them your friends?
... I would say not... Is that sad?

Fields.MenuText: Very. Everyone should have friends.
No. Making friends is hard.
Not if you're okay being alone.

Fields.DialogueText: Now you're making me feel bad.
A struggle. Like all things in life.
Being alone is not so bad.
So, then. I take it you're saying I need to make new friends, Captain.
I'm saying I was curious. That's all.
Hm.
@BATTLE
They never do let up, do they? To battle!
@BATTLE
I have a strange feeling about these battles, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: You're never satisfied, are you?
Me too. Something isn't right.
You said you wanted a challenge.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not that. Something feels wrong.
Then you have sensed it too.
And i think i've gotten my wish.
There's a bad energy in the air. Things feel odd.
Well the enemy certainly hasn't made it easy for us.
The patterns of battle. It's almost as if we're being led somewhere.
You think it's a trap.
Perhaps... or maybe I'm just being superstitious.
Superstition or not, let's keep our eyes open. We already know our targets are being sneakier than usual.
Yes, Captain.
Captain, I've been trying to figure out what we know about the Morganas' dummy convoy.
Go on.
For one thing, we're largely looking at refrigerator ships.
That makes a certain amount of sense. They were transporting food and perishables when they were taken, so the Morganas didn't bother cracking them open to get at the cargo.
Whatever. Since we know generally what they are, it's just a matter of simple research to figure out where they must have come from.
So... they were brought to some starting location close to where they were originally taken, and just left to drift near established shipping lanes?

Fields.MenuText: That's brilliant! You're amazing.
And you came up with this approach all on your own?
We have to act on this immediately!

Fields.DialogueText: Don't try to make me blush, Captain.
Of course! How else? Hmph...
Agreed!
Do it! Set a course and prepare for battle!
Yes, Captain!
So I've been mapping the points from which they were taken and the points at which the Morganas have used them as bait.
Interesting. And you've learned...?
Well, I'd bet the Morganas aren't fueling these things, and they don't want to burn too much of their own fuel towing them.
That's the hunch! They're probably not very mobile, and... well, some of the U-boats claim to have deep insights into where the Atlantic currents might be moving these things.
And you've talked to them? They're willing to help?
They're willing to help you even if they don't like me. I can live with that.
I have a good place to start looking, Captain. I just need an okay from you.
@BATTLE
We've spotted a group of civilian ships in the mist, Captain. They're not responding to our hails.
The location's about right. I don't see too many of them, though. The Morganas were supposed to have collected more.
Hmm...
What's wrong?
Something doesn't feel right.
You can at least take some comfort from the fact it's not a group of thirteen.
I'm being serious. What should we do?

Fields.MenuText: Confirm they're uninhabited, and attack. If we start costing them resources, the Morganas'll come running.
Let's approach cautiously for now.
Perhaps it's best to hold back for now.

Fields.DialogueText: A swift frontal attack? It could work.
Yes, that may be wise.
Maybe. This feels like a trap.
*ALARM*
Too late!
It simplifies things, at least.
@BATTLE
Captain, it's hard to get a sense of exactly what's going on, but... I think there are Morganas converging on us from all sides. They're not all close, but they're coming.
Well, we set out to kick a hornet's nest...
Oh, I wasn't complaining! It's just...
I know, they'll be scattered all through this area.
That means we could end up surrounded. Maybe we already are.

Fields.MenuText: We'll have to fight our way through!
Stay calm. We don't know that for sure yet.
We need to come up with a plan.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent! We'll show them how strong we are!
If we wait too long the Morganas will seize the advantage.
A show of force sounds like an excellent plan to me.
Either way, we're in for a long fight.
Bring on the battle!
@BATTLE
We're close. It won't be long before we've at least won some room to breathe.
They're relentless.

Fields.MenuText: Trust me, we're almost there.
Don't lose nerve on me now.
Now might be a good time for one of your prayers.

Fields.DialogueText: You've taken us this far, Captain.
Me? NEVER!
I'll save the prayers for the time being.
I'll make you a wager, Captain.
What kind of wager?
If we win this next battle I'll treat the crew to a concert.
On your bandura?

Fields.MenuText: What happens if we lose?
We'd better not lose then!
Heh. Doesn't sound like much of a wager.

Fields.DialogueText: If we do it won't matter either way.
We never choose to fail! Remember?
Hmph... That's because you haven't heard my latest song!
@BATTLE
They never do let up, do they? To battle!
@BATTLE
Report.
We're not done yet.
... Okay, now report in more detail.
The Morganas we defeated don't account for the reported aircraft carriers and battleships.
I'm still sensing Morganas in the region, but they're not coming for us. I'd say they're regrouping somewhere in the east.
And there are still cargo ships unaccounted for as well.
To the east of us. That could mean they move on the Channel or the Bay of Biscay.
... I really like this plan.

Fields.MenuText: I'm very happy for you.
See if you still like it when we're surrounded by battleships.
Great. Now let's find a way to be smart about it.

Fields.DialogueText: And I'm very proud to be serving with you!
Let them come.
I'm open to suggestions, Captain.
Or that they come after us again and we finish them off!
I don't think so. They know their decoy fleet trick is just about exhausted - my bet is that they'll be after one last target that's softer than we are.
No, our job is to anticipate them and hunt them down - and then we'll just have to defeat some of the most powerful Morganas on the planet.
Another wave incoming, Captain!
@BATTLE
We're taking a beating and we still haven't intercepted the main fleet. You think they're just trying to slow us down?
I think they're trying to kill us, and slowing us down is just plan B.
It's good that we're not seeing abandoned cargo ships, though - they must be making an effort to tow them.
Of course, that means we have to consider the possibility that they're being repurposed as bombs or battering rams or...
Whatever it is, if we can catch them we'll beat them.
If only there was an easy way to slip past the ones out to slow us down...

Fields.MenuText: I haven't planned that far ahead yet.
I thought you were enjoying smashing everything in our path.
I'm working on that.

Fields.DialogueText: Well I think now's a good time to start.
I'd rather it wasn't all so spread out.
Let me guess...
If only we could pass for more of their derelict cargo ships, and just slide on through their net...
... Huh.
We can't, though. Can we?
Cossack, I think we need to get a hold of one of those decoy ships. If there's any chance the Morganas have marked them as friendlies, I want to figure it out and use it against them.
Finally! We're bringing the fight to the enemy.
The immediate question is, do we double back and hope to recover one of the ones they left behind, or do we push forward and try to find a straggler?
*MEOW*
AAH! It's the cat!
I'm starting to think he likes you.
Well, the feeling is NOT mutual!
This is no good, Captain. That feline is going to curse our mission.
He's been here the whole time. We've been fine so far.
Yes, but he's stayed QUIET!

Fields.MenuText: Don't get superstitious on me now.
There's nothing wrong with the cat. Deal with it.
He just wants to be your friend.

Fields.DialogueText: My superstitions are real, Captain.
Maybe I will, by tossing him overboard!
I have NO use for feline friends!
Maybe he'd like one of your songs.
Bah! That creature will get nothing from me!
*MEOW*
AH! Get away! GET AWAY! Foul creature!
I'll... just plan on my own then.
Morganas ahead, Captain. No cargo ships that I can sense, but the day still won't be a waste.
@BATTLE
Captain, there is something I do not understand... about friends.
What about them?
If you do not have battle to bond you... how do you stay friends?
Hmm... good question.

Fields.MenuText: Not all friendships are meant to last.
Common interests. Shared history. Your real friends will be there for you - it just happens organically.
I suppose you find a way.

Fields.DialogueText: Then why have them?
Strange... I find that comforting.
Then friendship is like any fight.
If we win the war, will you and I remain... friends?
Of course. Or, at least, I hope so.
You hope we remain friends? Or win the war?
... Both.
Captain, Morganas spotted up ahead!
And...?
And they're detaching cables... or maybe tendrils... from a refrigerator ship.
How are you feeling about this?
Well, I have not seen that cat. That is a good omen.
It's ironic, isn't it?
The Morganas take over our ships. Now we have to take over one of theirs.
I'd like to think of it more like reclaiming lost property.
@BATTLE
How's our new guest?
Comatose. Still. Captain, I know you never believed the last refugees were bad luck, but *this* guy...
I know. But, Cossack, the Morganas left him on that cargo ship and kept him alive for a reason.
To torture him, from the looks of it.
I think they did more to him than that. I think *he's* what they marked. No special paint, no signal devices - I think they did something to his mind that other Morganas can sense.
Now let's hope we don't get attacked in the meantime.
Anything I can do to help?
The crew might like some music while they work.
... From me?

Fields.MenuText: Why not? I won the wager.
Don't tell me the brave warrior is afraid of a public performance.
Sure, if you'd like to.

Fields.DialogueText: HA! That is true.
Me? Afraid? NEVER!
... I think I would. Yes.
I'll play a song that will have the crew working twice as hard!
They detect him, and they don't attack the wreck he's on. Hopefully that'll work for us as well.
Even if you're right - and it's totally untested...
You're the one who usually likes the big risks.
Da. But I'm not going to pass for a wreck.
The plan is creative camouflage. If it makes the Morganas even fractionally less inclined to get in our way as we zero in on their main battle group... well, it's worth trying.
@BATTLE
... Seems like a good time for it. You think you can make it louder than the gunfire?
Please. Remember who you're talking to.
*ALARM*
Captain? Morganas in sight. They're not moving to intercept... but unless you want us to kill the engines they're going to figure out we're not just drifting.
@BATTLE
Captain, we should probably talk about the camouflage and alterations to the ship.
The structural stuff was secured well enough for cruising, but not all the rigging held up in combat conditions.
Right. Were the props in bad enough shape to be a hazard to the crew?
Does that mean I can throw the cat overboard? That would help a lot!
Stop it.
Can we fasten our disguise more securely? As long as our guest is alive and compliant, it does seem to provide us with an edge. A small one, but still.
Well, we've learned a thing or two about how not to do it. But our fake damage is showing a fair amount of wear, Captain.
Even if it doesn't break off in the middle of a fight, the faster we go the less convincing it's going to be. For more reasons than the obvious.

Fields.MenuText: Why is it always one problem after the other?
Let's keep pushing forward.
I'm having second thoughts on this plan.

Fields.DialogueText: Getting rid of the cat will solve most of our problems, I think.
Yes! We've come too far now.
We can't shy away now, Captain.
For now, I say we press forward and take our chances.
She's right... we keep going, as hard as we can push the engines.
The damn things can't be too far ahead of us now anyway.
Here's hoping, Captain.
Looks like Fire's in the lead. Hell with it - hopefully sinking them will be faster than waiting for them to move on.
No, not quite. But our Belle might have had something to do with that.
Single-handedly canceling out bad luck wherever she goes.
By the time the shooting stopped, we looked like a destroyer again. Maybe not exactly a Tribal-class silhouette, but definitely a warship.
How's our progress?
So far, so good. I can sense a few drowsy Morganas around us, but we've slowed the engines and they aren't showing any interest.
At this rate we'll sneak right past the guard dogs.

Fields.MenuText: Don't jinx it.
Let's hope so.
Yes, but let's stay alert.

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! My superstitions are rubbing off on you.
I do, obviously. But, if I'm honest, I wouldn't mind a fight.
Yes. Hope for the best - plan for the worst.
*BOOM*
What was that?
Captain! Some of the sheet metal we rigged to simulate hull damage just tore free!
Our disguise is falling apart?
At least the Morganas aren't responding.
*ALARM*
I think you jinxed it, Cossack.
@BATTLE
We're taking a lot of damage, Captain.
Yeah. The camouflage may have helped us avoid a skirmish or two, but I think they've figured it out.
*ALARM*
Another wave is approaching. What do we do?

Fields.MenuText: Let's use the element of surprise and attack.
Wait... let's see if they pass us.
What choice do we have? We fight!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! A preemptive assault!
I don't think our disguise is good enough.
If we must fight, we must embrace it.
We've been spotted!
Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Status report.
Repairs are underway, Captain. We're getting our camouflage back up.
I appreciate the effort, but I think the returns are diminishing as we approach the bulk of the battle group.
Are you... are you praying, Cossack?
Yes, a Russian prayer. For our safety.

Fields.MenuText: It's not like you to be worried.
That's a very sweet gesture.
How about a prayer for strength, instead?

Fields.DialogueText: I worry... I just don't always show it.
I believe a higher power is on our side.
The fight ahead may take more than strength, Captain.
@BATTLE
The fact that we're collecting more coma patients as we come across more abandoned cargo ships may not be helping, Captain.
Signal interference of some kind?
Or even just that they only expect one living victim per ship.
Very possible. But we can't just abandon them. Even with medical assistance it's a miracle they're all still hanging on.
From what I've heard about them, I'm not sure "miracle" is the word.
Captain! CAPTAIN!
Hope you're ready for a fight.
I'm always ready.
... But retreat is still an option.

Fields.MenuText: Not anymore.
... Wait, was that a joke?
We'll never escape if we don't fight.

Fields.DialogueText: Then, onward!
I just wanted to see what you'd say.
We'll never SURVIVE if we don't fight!
Hey. For the record, we're going to make it through this. I swear.
I believe you, Captain.
It's not because I'm your Captain...
It's because I'm your friend.
... Captain?
I won't let any of my friends aboard this ship down.
@BATTLE
I think we're finally coming up on the main Morgana group! See the carrier?!
Another group of stragglers, Captain! This should be satisfying!
@BATTLE
Amazing, Captain! History will tell stories of our victories here!
I'm just glad we've been able to hand off our rescued sailors. Captives. Whatever they were. Heaven knows they need more help than we can give.
I don't think I've ever had as much fun as I did against that carrier group!  HA!
... I have to play something. Good thing I have my bandura with me.
What are you doing?
Oh! I'm sorry. I was just in the mood to celebrate.
No, it's fine.

Fields.MenuText: Please, keep playing.
I don't know about you, but I could use a drink to celebrate.
I'm sure the crew appreciates your music.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll play my favorite tune!
Alcohol? Never touch the stuff. Dulls the mind for battle.
I'll play for any of them... except the cat.
Da, da, da - but you kept them alive and did all you could! Now you get to enjoy our successes!
Don't ever change, Cossack.
Oh, look. Destroyers. I almost feel sorry for them.
@BATTLE
Captain, a request.
For the last time, Cossack, the cat stays!
No, it is not that...
Then what?
Well, since the mission is officially complete, I thought some R&R would be in order.
Since when are you more interested in recreation than battle?
I understand the warrior's need for rest.
And we're not too far from the Canary Islands...

Fields.MenuText: Why not? Let's have an adventure!
I feel like you have an ulterior motive here.
Let's not. It could be dangerous.

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! I love it!
Well... Tenerife is known for its beautiful flowers.
And since when do we shy away from danger?
We'll set a course, under one condition.
More conditions? Name it.
We forget about battle, just for a little bit...
And just act like friends.
Ha. You drive a hard bargain, Captain.
No, you don't.
Nyet.
So I was thinking of what you asked about friendship, Cossack.
It's okay... I understand.
You do?
Da. After the war, after our battles...
I'll understand if we never see each other again.

Fields.MenuText: It could happen.
No, that's not what I meant.
I hope that won't be the case.

Fields.DialogueText: I will be sad. But I will be okay.
It's not? Then I'm afraid I'm confused.
Maybe it's best we don't get too attached to one another.
Actually, I had an idea. I think you'll like it.
What is it?
Chess!
Chess?
Yes, we can play together. This way we can be friends outside of battle.
I've never played chess. Is it fun?
It's just like battle.
... If that's true, you have many interesting games ahead of you, Captain.
@BATTLE
There is more to this game of chess than meets the eye.
Yes, it's as much about strategy as it is aggressiveness.
I don't understand why I can't simply move the pieces as I see fit.
Real battle is not so restrictive.

Fields.MenuText: But then it wouldn't be a challenge.
Complaining because I keep beating you?
Did I mention it also requires patience?

Fields.DialogueText: ... I do find the challenge fascinating.
That won't be happening for long if I keep practicing.
I have plenty of patience. No, hurry up so I can have my turn.
*ALARM*
We have Morganas incoming!
... Just makes you want to flip the board, doesn't it?
@BATTLE
They never do let up, do they? To battle!
@BATTLE
Will we be getting new orders soon?
I think that's pretty likely, yes.

Fields.MenuText: I can tell you hate the routine patrols.
I'm content to wait a while before our next mission.
I hope they bring us a challenge!

Fields.DialogueText: It does tend to get boring.
Just not too long, I hope.
Yes! The more difficult, the better!
I will say I've had plenty of time to practice playing chess.
Meaning you think you can beat me?
One does not know until one tries.
I'll make you another wager. If I win we get rid of the bad luck cat.
And if I win?
We send the cat ashore instead of firing it out of a cannon!
Either way, my victory will bring you luck!
You're something else, Cossack.
What are friends for?
